ratings.comment: Cal presents a lot of material, and it's not always crystal clear what his expectations are--but he does everything for a reason and really makes you think! Take the class for Cal if no other reason: he's like a grandfather with an amazing sense of humor and a WEALTH of knowledge about everything science. Take advantage of him, please!
best class ever!  soooo fun.  thought provoking lectures and awesome field trips! cal dewitt is the man!

Cal DeWitt is the greatest man I have ever met. His methods may seem non-conventional at first, but everything in this class aligns perfectly. If you get the chance, go to Coffee hours and speak with Cal, he is probably the most interesting person I have ever met. Take advantage of his knowledge.

I took Environmental Science from Dr. DeWitt about 15 years ago. I continue to think about and wrestle with what I learned in this course, and live much more environmentally responsible as a result. The field trips are one of my fondest memories in college. No course influenced me as much as Dr. DeWitt's. Highly recommended!

Most memorable lectures I ever had. After taking the class in over a year, I still remember the lectures very well. I really learned to appreciate the environment and spurred lots of interest because of this class. Exams are based off of lectures and readings, but you'll know what to expect because he only tests you on the most important material.

A really awesome guy. Knows basically everything about the natural world. Lectures are all over the place, but occasionally he gets in a comprehensible stride. Not difficult at all if you do the reading and take notes in lecture. Tests are easy.

IES 126 isn't your typical college class. It's not about getting an "A," (which is easy to do - Cal wants everyone to get an A) it's about furthering your appreciation for and understanding of the environment. Cal's lectures are very unorthodox, and he'll ramble a lot. But he's an incredibly interesting teacher with a lot of knowledge in his field.

Cal is extremely knowledgeable, but his lectures are all over the place and I didn't learn much from him.  No outlines for lectures, he just randomly talks about things.  The labs are great though.  Dave is a great instructor and is pretty funny once you get used to his style.

Cal is hands down one of the best professors at Madison. He's an amazing guy with so much knowledge and life experience. I've learned so much from him and his class, and he gave me a better understanding of the environment and how to live my life..the class is fairly easy if you stay on top of things and do the work he tells you to do.TAKE THIS CLA

Best professor I have ever had, without question.  I am dumbfounded by the negative review.  Cal is the NICEST old man ever, and probably the most knowledgable person you will ever encounter.  Class is a breeze if you just show up.  You will learn a lot.  TAKE THIS CLASS!!!

Really an easy class.  As long as you take notes, you will not be surprised on exams.  Get an A on midterms and there is no final.  Cal is awesome, I learned so much from him.  He really expanded my knowledge and he connects lots of enviro st info.  Take this class, you wont regret it

AWESOME class; really furthered my appreciation for the environment. Lectures are a bit rambling, but this guy is full of knowledge and I was always interested. The labs are field trips (Arb, water treatment plant...) and I learned tons of random stuff. (Not for I-got-dirt-on-my-fancy-shoes types.)

Many students will say they loved Cal and this class but don't listen to them. He is so full of himself and dry. The lectures are boring and not relative to the bad text or labs. The only good part are the field trips with Dave. Cal is unreliable and uber-religious. He is famous though, I guess.
